title: Fundamentals of Programming
description: Interdisciplinary approach to programming combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence
description: Rigorous treatment of artificial intelligence theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Intermediate Cybersecurity
description: Advanced exploration of cybersecurity covering current research and industry practices.

title: Applied Web Development
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of web development. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Advanced Software Engineering
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in software engineering. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Human-Computer Interaction
description: Comprehensive study of human-computer interaction with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Software Engineering
description: In-depth analysis of software engineering principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Advanced Data Structures
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in data structures. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.
prerequisites: COMP 399 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Database Systems
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of database systems. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: COMP 346 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Human-Computer Interaction
description: Comprehensive study of human-computer interaction with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: COMP 399 and senior standing or graduate status
